intro: Hieracium froelichianum subsp. sparsipilum, commonly known as the sparse-haired hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright stems and basal leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its subspecies status reflects subtle morphological differences from other Hieracium species.
